title: Feature Request: Creating new local folders
content:
I often want to move a mail from my inbox to one of the Local Folders I've created. I find that the Right Click > Move To > Recent list is very helpful.

BUT... sometimes I need a brand new folder e.g. I have a list of companies that I correspond with, and might need a new folder for that company. When I create that new folder, it'd be great if that could get pushed into the 'Recent' list or even to the 'Move to [folder name] Again option for quickness.

NB I tried to find an option for creating feature requests, but could not. Would happily repost this if pointed in the right direction; or if some savvy person would like to do so, I'm equally happy with that :-)

Hooray for Thunderbird!
creator: ian180

title: Navigating the message list with the PC keyboard in 112.0 Beta, accessing messages from another profile, switching to "strict MIME"
content:
Hello, I have several questions.

  1. 1. Today, Thunderbird got automatically updated to version 112.0 beta and suddenly it was impossible for me to navigate to specific messages (I'm using speech synthesizers to read everything, which means I have to do everything entirely from my PC keyboard, without using the mouse). When I pressed Tab or Shift+Tab several times, I got to the list of messages but then when I wanted to select a message by pressing the arrow keys, suddenly the selected message opened and I was unable to get back to the list of messages.

I then wanted to revert to an older version so I installed version 102.9.0. When I ran it, I was asked to create a new profile. When I did that, there was no option at all to get to the messages that I had previously saved locally within the other profile. So my question is this: How do I access the messages that were saved locally on my hard drive within the currently inaccessible profile when I had previously set up multiple email accounts for that profile? Or how do I navigate to specific messages in version 112.0 Beta which DOES allow me to access the other profile? I mean, the one and only reason why I've now gone back to 102.9 is that I'm unable to navigate to specific messages in 112.0 beta even though version 111 was still manageable for me (it was enough to find the folder, press Tab, find the message, press Enter and there it was).

  1. 2. How do I tell Thunderbird to always conform to "strict MIME" for my outgoing messages (i.e. to never use "Content transfer encoding = 8bit")?
  1. 3. How do I tell Thunderbird to always encode my outgoing textual or HTML content into UTF-8?

Thank you in advance.

Petr
creator: petrparizek2000

title: Thunderbird Slow Due to (Re)Checking/Connecting to IMAP Folders
content:
Thunderbird (now 102.9.0) regularly freezes but doesn't crash for me on Windows 10 and 11. Substantially the same behavior occurs whether I'm in troubleshooting mode or have addons enabled.

In Thunderbird, I have 3 mail accounts, and all 3 are IMAP accounts. From the status bar notifications, it seems a large part of Thunderbird's slowness arises because opening a new IMAP folder causes Thunderbird to authenticate to the mail service and check for new messages in that folder.

I already have Thunderbird downloading all of the mail in the IMAP folders subscribed to in each account. So, is there a way to prevent the "recheck for new messages in a folder when opening that folder" behavior and, e.g., only check for new messages on the schedule in each account's settings, by doing "Get Messages," etc.?

Thunderbird is about as responsive as I would expect when I'm working in offline mode. So, I suppose I could open Thunderbird, allow it to sync up to the IMAP accounts, then go offline to work on the messages that came in, then go back online to sync what I've done to the server. But I suppose I'm hoping to avoid that online state toggling if there's a way of doing so.

Thank you so much for your thoughts!
creator: jdavidstark

title: Dragging and dropping subfolders in error
content:
Hi Thunderbird; I am a financial contributor to your great e-mail program. One irksome issue I would like to see resolved to have a pop up asking"are you sure you want to do this" when moving e-mail subfolders two and more tiers down from one subfolder to another. I have over 100 e-mail subfolders in our company e-mail program and many more beneath those. Many times I will drag and drop e-mails directly from my inbox screen into subfolders in the left pane.(rather than using the "move" command) Occasionally I do not keep pressure on my left mouse button to do this. (I know , my fault). Instead of moving the specific e-mail(s), I now inadvertantly pick up a subfolder and drop it in a different folder, not realizing I have done this. When I finally realize the errant folder is not where it supposed to be( sometimes a day or two later), I spend a fair amount of time tracking it down and moving it back to it's original position.

Having a pop up message asking me if I really want to do this would be helpful and I'm sure would be appreciated by others who have 'lost' folders in a similar fashion.

Would be great to see in your upcoming supernova version 115 Thanks for considering this

Ken Johnson
creator: kjohnson633

title: Thunderbird email
content: I just downloaded and installed Thunderbird to use for my email because I have nothing but trouble with the Windows 11 Mail program on my computer. Even if I try to send myself an email it says the sending failed because the server was unable to access the mailbox. My email address is through Frontier, which uses Yahoo Mail to handle it's email. My email address is xxxxxx@frontier.com. When I check my settings on Thunderbird it has my correct email address for account name and email address, and under server settings it has my correct email address for user name, for server type says IMAP Mail Server, and for server name says imap.mail.yahoo.com. For port it says 993(default). I used to use Thunderbird on a previous laptop, with the same email address, and never had a problem. Can someone tell me what I might be missing?
